trans-unit.source: Update Media Services after Rolling Storage Access Keys
trans-unit.target: Update Media Services after Rolling Storage Access Keys

trans-unit.source: This articles give you guidance on how to update Media Services after rolling storage access keys.
trans-unit.target: This articles give you guidance on how to update Media Services after rolling storage access keys.

trans-unit.source: How To: Update Media Services after Rolling Storage Access Keys
trans-unit.target: How To: Update Media Services after Rolling Storage Access Keys

trans-unit.source: When you create a new Azure Media Services account, you are also asked to select an Azure Storage account that is used to store your media content.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new Azure Media Services account, you are also asked to select an Azure Storage account that is used to store your media content.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can add more than one storage accounts to your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can add more than one storage accounts to your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: When a new storage account is created, Azure generates two 512-bit storage access keys, which are used to authenticate access to your storage account.
trans-unit.target: When a new storage account is created, Azure generates two 512-bit storage access keys, which are used to authenticate access to your storage account.

trans-unit.source: To keep your storage connections more secure, it is recommended to periodically regenerate and rotate your storage access key.
trans-unit.target: To keep your storage connections more secure, it is recommended to periodically regenerate and rotate your storage access key.

trans-unit.source: Two access keys (primary and secondary) are provided in order to enable you to maintain connections to the storage account using one access key while you regenerate the other access key.
trans-unit.target: Two access keys (primary and secondary) are provided in order to enable you to maintain connections to the storage account using one access key while you regenerate the other access key.

trans-unit.source: This procedure is also called "rolling access keys".
trans-unit.target: This procedure is also called "rolling access keys".

trans-unit.source: Media Services has dependency on one of the storage keys (primary or secondary).
trans-unit.target: Media Services has dependency on one of the storage keys (primary or secondary).

trans-unit.source: Specifically, the locators that are used to stream or download your assets depend on the access key.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, the locators that are used to stream or download your assets depend on the access key.

trans-unit.source: When rolling storage access keys, you also need to make sure to update your locators so there will no interruption in your streaming service.
trans-unit.target: When rolling storage access keys, you also need to make sure to update your locators so there will no interruption in your streaming service.

trans-unit.source: After you regenerate a storage key, you must make sure to synchronize the update with Media Services.
trans-unit.target: After you regenerate a storage key, you must make sure to synchronize the update with Media Services.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes steps you would take to roll storage keys and update Media Services to use the appropriate storage key.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes steps you would take to roll storage keys and update Media Services to use the appropriate storage key.

trans-unit.source: Note, if you have multiple storage accounts, you would perform this procedure with each storage account.
trans-unit.target: Note, if you have multiple storage accounts, you would perform this procedure with each storage account.

trans-unit.source: Before executing steps described in this topic on a production account, make sure to test them on a pre-production account.
trans-unit.target: Before executing steps described in this topic on a production account, make sure to test them on a pre-production account.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Regenerate secondary storage access key
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Regenerate secondary storage access key

trans-unit.source: Start with regenerating secondary storage key.
trans-unit.target: Start with regenerating secondary storage key.

trans-unit.source: By default, the secondary key is not used by Media Services.
trans-unit.target: By default, the secondary key is not used by Media Services.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to roll storage keys, see <link><linkText>How to: View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to roll storage keys, see <link><linkText>How to: View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Step 2: Update Media Services to use the new secondary storage key
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Step 2: Update Media Services to use the new secondary storage key

trans-unit.source: Update Media Services to use the secondary storage access key.
trans-unit.target: Update Media Services to use the secondary storage access key.

trans-unit.source: You can use one of the following two methods to synchronize the regenerated storage key with Media Services.
trans-unit.target: You can use one of the following two methods to synchronize the regenerated storage key with Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure Portal: select your Media Service account, and click on the “MANAGE KEYS” icon on the bottom of the portal window.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Portal: select your Media Service account, and click on the “MANAGE KEYS” icon on the bottom of the portal window.

trans-unit.source: Depending on which storage key you want for the Media Services to synchronize with, select the synchronize primary key or synchronize secondary key button.
trans-unit.target: Depending on which storage key you want for the Media Services to synchronize with, select the synchronize primary key or synchronize secondary key button.

trans-unit.source: In this case, use the secondary key.
trans-unit.target: In this case, use the secondary key.

trans-unit.source: Use Media Services management REST API.
trans-unit.target: Use Media Services management REST API.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to construct the https://endpoint/<html></html>/services/mediaservices/Accounts/<html></html>/StorageAccounts/<html></html>/Key request in order to synchronize the specified storage key with Media Services. In this case, the secondary storage key value is used. For more information, see <link><linkText>How to: Use Media Services Management REST API</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows how to construct the https://endpoint/<html></html>/services/mediaservices/Accounts/<html></html>/StorageAccounts/<html></html>/Key request in order to synchronize the specified storage key with Media Services. In this case, the secondary storage key value is used. For more information, see <link><linkText>How to: Use Media Services Management REST API</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After this update existing locators (that have dependency on the old storage key).
trans-unit.target: After this update existing locators (that have dependency on the old storage key).

trans-unit.source: Wait for 30 minutes before performing any operations with Media Services (for example, creating new locators) in order to prevent any impact on pending jobs.
trans-unit.target: Wait for 30 minutes before performing any operations with Media Services (for example, creating new locators) in order to prevent any impact on pending jobs.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Update locators
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Update locators

trans-unit.source: After 30 minutes you can update existing locators so they take dependency on the new secondary storage key.
trans-unit.target: After 30 minutes you can update existing locators so they take dependency on the new secondary storage key.

trans-unit.source: To update expiration date on a locator, use <link><linkText>REST</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title></link> APIs.
trans-unit.target: To update expiration date on a locator, use <link><linkText>REST</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title></link> APIs.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you update the expiration date of a SAS locator, the URL changes.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you update the expiration date of a SAS locator, the URL changes.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Regenerate primary storage access key
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Regenerate primary storage access key

trans-unit.source: Regenerate the primary storage access key.
trans-unit.target: Regenerate the primary storage access key.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to roll storage keys, see <link><linkText>How to: View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to roll storage keys, see <link><linkText>How to: View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Update Media Services to use the new primary storage key
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Update Media Services to use the new primary storage key

trans-unit.source: Use the same procedure as described in <link><linkText>step 2</linkText><title></title></link> only this time synchronize the new primary storage access key with the Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Use the same procedure as described in <link><linkText>step 2</linkText><title></title></link> only this time synchronize the new primary storage access key with the Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Wait for 30 minutes before performing any operations with Media Services (for example, creating new locators) in order to prevent any impact on pending jobs.
trans-unit.target: Wait for 30 minutes before performing any operations with Media Services (for example, creating new locators) in order to prevent any impact on pending jobs.

trans-unit.source: Step 7: Update locators
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Update locators

trans-unit.source: After 30 minutes you can update existing locators so they take dependency on the new primary storage key.
trans-unit.target: After 30 minutes you can update existing locators so they take dependency on the new primary storage key.

trans-unit.source: To update expiration date on a locator, use <link><linkText>REST</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title></link> APIs.
trans-unit.target: To update expiration date on a locator, use <link><linkText>REST</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title></link> APIs.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you update the expiration date of a SAS locator, the URL changes.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you update the expiration date of a SAS locator, the URL changes.
